model_answer: A: A DNA double helix drawing with a highlighted boxed section labeled "GENES".

Answer: C: He talks about a coin flip lab and summarizes that DNA has genes with two alleles per gene.

The speaker refers to a coin flip lab to illustrate how genetic inheritance works, where each coin has two sides representing the two alleles of a gene. This helps viewers understand that every individual has two copies of each gene, one from each parent, and both alleles can be different.
